metadata.title: CVE-2023-51794 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Ffmpeg v.N113007-g8d24a28d06 allows alocal attacker to execute arbitrary code via thelibavfilter/af_stereowiden.c:120:69.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavcodec-extra60 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavcodec60 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavdevice60 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavfilter-extra - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavfilter-extra9 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavfilter9 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavformat-extra - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavformat-extra60 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavformat60 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libavutil58 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libpostproc57 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libswresample4 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
libswscale7 - 7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:6.0-6ubuntu1.1').
